messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1053
messages.msgSnippet: Space Camp is at Kennedy Space Center in Florida, although they may have one in California too.  Yup, the I have the info and they have a camp in Mountain
messages.messageBody:
Space Camp is at Kennedy Space Center in Florida, although they may have one
in California too. Yup, the I have the info and they have a camp in
Mountain View, CA. He's a little younger than our Mac, so he'd have to wait
another year longer. They have to be 7 with a recommended reading level of
2nd grade.

They have a website www.spacecamp.com. Maybe when they get a little older,
they could be email pals!

Bonnie

>were

>look like they could be brothers! :-)
>Mackenzie liked the picture of the Big Boy, a train we haven't seen yet,
>although we saw the Challenger running at RailFair, most impressive!
>
>Where is Space Camp?? Sounds like something Mackenzie might be interested
>in
>at some point...
>
> Blue Skies!

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1053
messages.msgSnippet: Nicki, In Erie.  :-)  The regulations are what kept me from trying to unschool in the first place.  Had to “go with the program.”  Glad to say that I
messages.messageBody:
Nicki,

 

In Erie.  J  The regulations are what kept me from trying to unschool in the first place.  Had to “go with the program.”  Glad to say that I figured out I didn’t have to!  J  Now I just have to make everything else work out with the unschooling.  Getting better, but it is an uphill struggle at the moment. 

My family came from Bucks county, genealogy fanatic, you know!  J 

Thanks,

 

 

Faith

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1053
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/24/01 3:33:31 AM Mountain Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/24/01 3:33:31 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Just wanted to add to my last post, remember, I just started unschooling
about a month ago. :-)
Anybody unschooling in PA?? I could use some suggestions on how to work my
logs to go along with the unschooling.
Thanks,
Faith
>>

Where abouts in PA. Faith? I am from PA. and visit once or twice a year.
My parents are in Berks County and ILS are in Montgomery C.. and Bucks. Just
curious. :o)

I was always afraid to move home b/c of the strict regulations. Good Luck
in all you are doing.

NICKI~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1053
messages.msgSnippet: From: Bonnie Painter  ... Wow Bonnie, that s amazing. Mackenzie even signs his name Mac and they look like they could be
messages.messageBody:
From: "Bonnie Painter" <bonniepainter@...>
>I think we are raising the same son! We will be venturing to Space Camp
>next year sometime (dad and son weekend, my husband really wants to go
>anyway). My son also has a website about our train adventures and we were
>planning on adding rockets from our trip to Kennedy last summer.
>
>Mac's site is www.geocities.com\boxcarmac
>
>Isn't funny how that happens...


Wow Bonnie, that's amazing. Mackenzie even signs his name "Mac" and they
look like they could be brothers! :-)
Mackenzie liked the picture of the Big Boy, a train we haven't seen yet,
although we saw the Challenger running at RailFair, most impressive!

Where is Space Camp?? Sounds like something Mackenzie might be interested in
at some point...

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "I told you I was going to grow up to be a
weirdo"
and Asa (10/5/99) Who says "Fishy swim!" at the aquarium, her favorite place
in the world
http://www.geocities.com/the_clevengers Flying Clevenger Family
